newsitem.title: USA: DuPont Co South American chairman dies.
newsitem.headline: DuPont Co South American chairman dies.

text.p: DuPont Co said Friday its chairman for South America had died but did not specify whether it had found a replacement.
The company said Jorge Nelson Rosas died on Thursday -- three months after being named chairman for the region.
Rosas, who died at 64, had worked with DuPont for 39 years, it said.
He became general director for South America with responsibility for Argentina, Brazil, Colombia and Venezuela in 1989, it said.
Rosas was named president for the region three years later, a post he held before earning the title of chairman last June.
